data.title: File destination info when jumping to a multi-defined symbol
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 / OSX
- Type: Request

When navigating to a symbol in a project, if that  symbol exists in multiple files VSCode allows you to choose wich one you one to jump to, but the information is incomplete as it does not describe the destination file (sorry I could not take a clean snapshot):

![xxx](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5497332/24801646/61740e22-1ba5-11e7-8986-53b1efe0fa10.png)

It would be great if we could also know the destination file (I took SublimeText as example):
![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5497332/24801701/9e10e102-1ba5-11e7-942b-15b27acf5727.PNG)

data.title: Command palette hidden when app focus lost
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 / OSX

I usually get into a situation where I have the command palette open, and I need to quicly change the window focus to a different one, and then continue typing in the palette. At that moment, the command palette disappears.
I'd like to request that this window remains visible when the APP focus changes, similar as Sublime Text does.

data.title: Key remapping using xkbd options broke with the keybinding changes in 1.11
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.10

I originally commented in #24057 but was told to open a separate issue.

I use the xkb option `caps:swapescape` to map my ESC key to the caps lock key in my keyboard layout because I like to use Vim mode for editing in VSCode. Since 1.11.0 VSCode caps lock does nothing (not even switch capitalization). The ESC key actually acts as an ESC key in VSCode but switches captitalization.

Since 1.11 can now read the keyboard layout it probably just does not handle options on it and therefore gets the key mapping wrong.

data.title: There should be a theme-invariant markdown preview with white background
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

When I use a dark theme, the markdown preview adheres to that theme and is also displayed dark.
In the majority of cases the markdown you edit will finally be rendered with a white background in real life. So even when I edit the mardown in a dark theme, the rendered preview should be as close to the final result as possible, which will most likely be with a white background.

Of course I could try to [create my own css](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/markdown#_using-your-own-css) for the preview but this is a) [hard to get right](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19962) and b) needs to play nice with all the other custom css that I added to `"markdown.styles"` that are specifc to the current project I am working on and that come from the actual site where the rendered html will be hosted.

Atom has an option like that. VS Code needs one too.
https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/pull/298#issuecomment-137035369

data.title: vscode has some error on the new wondows10 pro(version1703,the os version 15063 )
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:1.11.1 and 1.10.1
- OS Version:windows10 pro 15063(RS2)

Steps to Reproduce:

Can you read chinese? maybe I can't discribe it clearly. whatever, I explan it in both languages.

In chinese: 

1.我发现一个问题，今天上午笔记本率先更新了15063，打开主力软件基本没有问题。

然后顺手给台式机更新了系统。

刚刚发现vs code遇见一些小麻烦。

下图是台式机+vs code最新版本。然后可以注意到powshell起始位置不太对

https://pic3.zhimg.com/v2-88ba0676edaa2ed7f82b4bf5c24d14aa_r.png

git同步也有问题，反复同步不了。

刚开始怀疑是vs code新版本的锅，然后打开笔记本，准备同步文件时候，哎，笔记本上的vs code的powshell也出现错位，
https://pic2.zhimg.com/v2-83375f0d852c7ee7a05d41ff2e13d925_r.png

笔记本上的vs code是上一个版本，昨天一切都好好。看来这个锅必须创意者更新来背。我准备git 上报告vs code也同时反馈给windows开发人员吧。

In English:

I install the latest Windows Pro10 (version :15063), and then open the Vs code to work. I find the position of the powshell is different as usual,the picture link:https://pic3.zhimg.com/v2-88ba0676edaa2ed7f82b4bf5c24d14aa_r.png
 and cannot git any code. Vs code works well yesterday, there must be some errors with the latest Windows os. I have told  the team of Windows, and then tell you too.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Modify a file and make a commit
2. Modify that same file again, save. Go into the source control view.
3. Click on the file name on the left. this open a new window with the title "FileName (Working Tree)".
4. This shows differences of the previous commit as well as the current one. It should only show current changes, not committed one.

1.11 has been a bit of a disaster of a release so far :(

data.title: Not able to launch MEAN application from VS Code
data.body:
Testing #22279 

- Set up MEAN from http://learn.mean.io/
- Initialise a sample MEAN app
- Open VS Code on the above app
- Open Debug view and create the node based launch that get created by default
- Change `server` to `server.js` in `program` argument
- Launch the program

Open the URL localhost:3000 in the browser. 

Expected to see sample MEAN web page
But Page not found is shown

If you run `node server.js`  from terminal, it works

data.title: editor.action.quickFix command cannot be completed using the keyboard
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In editor (typescript file) use editor.action.quickFix command (ctrl+.) to automatically generate import statement for certain type
2. Pop-up window is shown with the one or more options (e.g. Import xxx from 'yyy')
3. It is not possible to select any popup menu item using keyboard (arrow keys). So in my case, I need to use touchpad or mouse to choose the menu item.

data.title: Git: Can no longer create a branch using the checkout button
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a project in VScode that has Git
2. Click on the checkout out button in the left button corner
3. Type a new Branch
4. No Option to add branch

Before this update when I wanted to branch I used to click that button all the time to create a new branch off master but now have to open the terminal it was a really handy feature and upset this has either stopped working or been removed.

I already tried to reinstall VS Code and updated Git – No success.

Any ideas? Thanks.

data.title: Default node launch does not work when there is no .js extension for Program attribute
data.body:
Testing #22279 

- Create a sample node express app. Make server.js as entry point.
- In the package.json give the start argument as follows
`node server`
- Open Debug view and create a node launch 
- This will create following default launch configs

```
"configurations": [
		{
			"type": "node",
			"request": "launch",
			"name": "Launch Program",
			"program": "${workspaceRoot}/server"
		},
		{
			"type": "node",
			"request": "attach",
			"name": "Attach to Port",
			"address": "localhost",
			"port": 5858
		}
	]
```

Start `Launch Program` and you get following error

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/24793476/7a001760-1b82-11e7-843f-a20cd4c57f80.png)

Change `program` attribute to `${workspaceRoot}/server.js` and launch. It works now

data.title: Allow to open a file in a specific editor group
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: centOS 7.0

Its will be awesome if we can right click on a file in explorer column and specify to open in a panel. It will be even better if shortcuts( 1, 2 and 3 )is assigned to same functionality. For example, selecting a file and hitting number 2 will open that file in 2nd panel.

data.title: Code completion not working inside strings
data.body:
After  1.11.1 upgrade code completion inside strings is not working.

OS Ubuntu 16.04
Version 1.11.1
Commit d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39
Date 2017-04-06T13:55:56.395Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

I've downgraded to 1.10 to get it working again.
